data.1: NUN. I CALL to witness the pen and what they inscribe,
data.2: You are not demented by the grace of your Lord.
data.3: There is surely reward unending for you,
data.4: For you are verily born of sublime nature.
data.5: So you will see, and they will realise,
data.7: Verily your Lord knows those who have gone astray from His path, and He knows those who are guided on the way.
data.8: So do not comply with those who deny:
data.9: They only want that you should relent, so that they may come to terms.
data.10: Do not heed a contemptible swearer,
data.12: Who hinders men from (doing) good, the transgressor, the iniquitous,
data.13: Crude, and above all, mean and infamous,
data.14: Simply because he possesses wealth and children.
data.15: When you recite Our revelations to him, he says: "These are fables of long ago."
data.16: We shall brand him on the muzzle.
data.17: We have tried you as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to gather the fruits in the morning
data.18: But did not add: "If God may please."
data.19: Then a calamity from your Lord fell upon it, but they remained fast asleep.
data.20: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
data.21: At daybreak they called to each other:
data.22: "If you want to gather the fruits, let us go early to the plantation."
data.23: So they departed, talking in low voices:
data.24: "Let no needy person come to you within it today."
data.25: They left early in the morning bent on this purpose.
data.26: When they saw (and did not recognise it) they said: "Surely we have lost the way.
data.27: No. In fact we have been deprived of it."
data.28: One who was temperate among them, said: "Did I not say: ´Why don´t you priase God?´"
data.29: "Glory to our Lord," they said; we were really in the wrong."
data.30: Then they started blaming one another,
data.31: Saying: "Alas the woe, we were iniquitous.
data.32: Maybe our Lord will give us better than this. We turn to our Lord in supplication."
data.33: Such is Our chastisement; and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater, if only they knew!
data.34: For those who fear God there are pleasure gardens with their Lord.
data.35: Should We treat those who submit and obey in the same way as those who are culpable?
data.36: What has come upon you that you judge in such a wise?
data.37: Or have you a Book in which you read
data.38: That you can surely have whatever you choose?
data.39: Or have you taken a binding promise from Us which would hold till the Day of Judgement, that you will get whatever you demand?
data.40: Ask them: "Which of you is able to vouch for this?"
data.41: Or have they any partners? Let them bring their partners then, if what they say is true.
data.42: On the day the great calamity befalls, and they are called to bow in homage, they will not be able to do so.
data.43: Lowered will be their eyes, disgrace overwhelming them. They had indeed been called to bow in homage when they were free of blame.
data.44: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me. We shall lead them step by step to (ruin) in a way they will not know.
data.45: Yet I will give them respite: Surely My plan is compact.
data.46: Do you ask for any compensation from them that they are burdened with want?
data.47: Or do they have knowledge of the unknown which they copy down?
data.48: So wait with patience for the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like (onah) of the fish who called (to his Lord) when he was choked with anger.
data.49: Had it not been for a favour from his Lord he would have been cast blame-worthy on a barren plain.
data.50: Then his Lord chose him and placed him among the upright.
data.51: But the unbelievers would like to stare you out of balance when they hear the warning, and say: "Surely he is possessed;"
data.52: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
